title: Executive Function Support System
description: A comprehensive routine to support executive functioning challenges common in ADHD and autism. Focuses on working memory, task initiation, emotional regulation, and cognitive flexibility using evidence-based strategies.

setupSteps.question: What's your biggest executive function challenge? (working memory, task initiation, emotional regulation, time management, organization)
What time of day do you feel most cognitively sharp?
What's your preferred way to capture thoughts/tasks? (phone notes, paper, voice memos, specific app)
What helps you feel emotionally regulated? (movement, breathing, music, sensory tool, etc.)

steps.message: üß† EF Support session! Let's work on your ${mainEFChallenge} challenge with neurodivergent-friendly strategies.
üßò Emotional regulation check: Use your ${emotionalRegulator} to get into an optimal state for cognitive work
üìù Working memory dump: Use your ${captureMethod} to write down everything currently in your head (no organizing, just capturing)
‚≠ê Priority filter: Circle or highlight just ONE thing from your dump that feels most important today
üéØ Task initiation: Set a 15-minute timer and start working on your chosen priority (momentum over perfection!)
üß† Week 2 of EF training! Your ${mainEFChallenge} skills are strengthening.
üßò Emotional regulation ritual (becoming automatic!)
üìù Working memory external storage (brain dump)
‚≠ê Priority selection (training your filtering skills)
üéØ Focused work sprint (building sustained attention)
üîÑ Cognitive flexibility practice: Look at your brain dump and identify 2 different ways you could approach one task
‚è∞ Time awareness building: Estimate how long your next task will take, then track actual time
üåô Evening EF review: Before bed, spend 3 minutes reflecting on what executive function strategies worked best today
üöÄ EF Mastery level! You're developing sophisticated strategies for managing ${mainEFChallenge} and more.
üßò Advanced emotional regulation: Notice your stress level (1-10) and use ${emotionalRegulator} to optimize it
üìù Strategic brain dump: Categorize thoughts as you capture them (tasks, worries, ideas, reminders)
‚≠ê Multi-factor prioritization: Choose priority based on importance, energy level, and available time
üéØ Enhanced focus session: 20-minute deep work with intentional attention management
üîÑ Flexibility challenge: When you feel stuck, try the '3 alternative approaches' exercise
üìä Working memory support: Create external reminders for any commitments you made during your work session
üïê Midday EF check-in: Quick emotional regulation + task switching if needed
üåÜ Afternoon planning: Use your ${captureMethod} to plan the next day's priorities while today is fresh
üåô EF reflection & tomorrow's preparation: What worked? What would you adjust? Set yourself up for tomorrow's success.

effect.message: üß† EF Science: You're training your prefrontal cortex! Each time you externalize working memory and practice emotional regulation, you're building executive function strength.
üéâ One week of EF training! Your ${mainEFChallenge} skills are developing. Ready to integrate more advanced strategies like cognitive flexibility and time awareness?
üöÄ Three weeks of consistent EF practice! You're developing a sophisticated toolkit for managing neurodivergent executive function challenges. Ready for mastery level?
üèÜ Six weeks of EF development! You've built lasting skills for managing ${mainEFChallenge} and supporting your neurodivergent brain's executive functions. This is mastery!
üí° EF Tip: Executive function skills improve with practice, not pressure. Your neurodivergent brain is learning new patterns - be patient and consistent!

effect.taskDescription: Experiment with different ${captureMethod} setups to find your optimal external working memory system
Create a personalized 'EF Emergency Kit' with your best strategies for when ${mainEFChallenge} becomes overwhelming
